metadata.description: Comprehensive programming languages analysis from developer roadmap

python.name: Python

core_features: Dynamic typing with type hints support (PEP 484)

topics: Python syntax and basic data types

basic_concepts: Variables and data types (int, float, str, bool)

coding_standards: Use meaningful variable and function names
Keep functions small and focused (single responsibility)
Use type hints for better code documentation
Write docstrings for modules, classes, and functions
Use list comprehensions for simple transformations
Use context managers for resource management
Handle exceptions appropriately (don't use bare except)

patterns.name: Singleton Pattern
patterns.use_case: Ensure a class has only one instance

patterns.name: Factory Pattern
patterns.use_case: Create objects without specifying exact class

patterns.name: Strategy Pattern
patterns.use_case: Define family of algorithms, make them interchangeable

patterns.name: Decorator Pattern
patterns.use_case: Add new functionality to objects dynamically

coding_standards: Prefer const and let over var

patterns.name: Revealing Module Pattern
patterns.use_case: Expose public API while keeping internals private

coding_standards: Use type for unions and primitives
Use unknown instead of any when needed
Use const assertions for literal types
Define return types for public APIs
Keep types DRY with utility types

go.name: Go (Golang)

modern_features: Clear built-in for maps and slices (Go 1.21+)

basic_concepts: Basic data types (int, float, string, bool)

coding_standards: Prefer Result over panic for errors

modern_features: var keyword for local variable type inference

coding_standards: Use meaningful variable and method names

kotlin.name: Kotlin

core_features: Null safety built into type system

primary: Data science and ML (Kotlin for Data Science)

topics: Scope functions (let, run, with, apply, also)

basic_concepts: Variables (val for immutable, var for mutable)

coding_standards: Use when instead of if-else chains
Use extension functions for utility methods
Prefer sealed classes for restricted hierarchies
Prefer smart pointers over raw pointers
Avoid using namespace std in headers
Use type declarations and strict types
Use prepared statements for database queries
Use meaningful variable and function names
Write unit tests for critical code

patterns.name: MVC Pattern
patterns.use_case: Separation of concerns in web apps

html_features: Local storage and session storage APIs

topics: Common HTML tags (div, p, h1-h6, a, img)

coding_standards: Keep CSS specific but not too specific
Use BEM or consistent naming convention

beginners.reason: Simple syntax, extensive learning resources, immediate feedback

systems_programming.reason: Low-level control, high performance, system access

data_science_ml.reason: Rich ecosystem, extensive libraries, industry standard

performance_critical.reason: Compiled languages, minimal overhead, fine-grained control
